p: In different parts of the world, different species of the genus Thymus have traditionally been used to treat various disorders such as bronchitis, asthma, pertussis, laryngitis, tonsillitis, and cough [ 20]. Thymus serrulatus Hochst. Ex Benth (family Lamiaceae) grows in Ethiopia and has traditionally been used to treat influenza [ 21] and cough [ 22]. T. serrulatus is a much-branched perennial subshrub that grows in the Afromontane and Afroalpine zones of Ethiopia and Eritrea [ 23].
